a.title: Go to George-Little Rock Community Schools.

div.p: Dear George-Little Rock Students, Parents, Staff, and Community,

Today Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds declared Iowa schools closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This comes as no surprise as Iowa cases of COVID-19 have not peaked in Iowa. The GLR leadership, teachers and administration, have discussed possible scenarios. The Leadership team will be meeting on Monday to discuss plans and procedures going forward. Please look to the district website, www.george-littlerock.org, the district Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/George-Little-Rock-Community-School-District-230125240354744/, and communications through JMC.
Our teachers will continue to serve their students as best we can. Our meal program will continue until further notice.
In the meantime, please continue to practice good health procedures and stay healthy.

div.class: vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text vc_sep_color_grey

div.p: On March 15, 2020, Governor Reynolds recommended that all Iowa schools close for four weeks. At George-Little Rock we decided to continue to have school for two days in order to allow parents to make arrangements for their childrenâs care. It also allowed teachers to meet with their students to make some sort of arrangements. George-Little Rock Schools also made a decision to close for two weeks rather than the recommended four weeks and reevaluate the situation as the return date of April 1, 2020 approached.

In the time since our closure, the situation regarding COVID-19 has not improved. Therefore, the George-Little Rock Schools will close for an additional two weeks with an anticipated return date of April 14, 2020. The State of Iowa has created a Continuous Learning Task Force to provide recommendations to districts on how we can work with students during this closure. Please go to our website,Â https://george-littlerock.org/,Â for upcoming information on classes and assignments.

Please remember that children ages 18 and under are eligible for FREE lunch and breakfast program a lunch and a breakfast for the next day. Meals can be picked up at both the Little Rock and George sites. Delivery is available for those who cannot get to the pick-up sites. Please contact Colleen Trei atÂ ctrei@george-littlerock.orgÂ or 712-475-3311 ext # 127
More FAQs for families and parentsÂ here

div.h3: If you would like information about GLR schools or if there is any way we can assist you, please do not hesitate to contact us. We would love to give you more information about any of our schools.

article.class: george-little-rock-schools-announcements post-6307 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-george-little-rock-schools-announcements intense_post

div.p: The George-Little Rock Community School District (GLR) is based in George and Little Rock, Iowa. George-Little Rock Community Schools are home to the Mustangs and proud of their successful academics, athletics, fine arts programs, and student organizations.

ul.li:
500 E. Indiana Ave.
P.O. Box 6
George, IA 51237
